com.streetsofboston.smugmug.v1_2_1.system
Class Session

java.lang.Object
  com.streetsofboston.smugmug.v1_2_1.system.Session

public class Session
extends java.lang.Object

This class represents a logged-in Session. It is a pre-requisite for each operation that needs to get or send data from/to Smugmug. A session is tied to a Session-ID, which can be shared by one or more Sessions. Each session is tied to a user Account.

Author:
Anton Spaans

Field Detail

API_KEY

public static java.lang.String API_KEY
Default SmugFig API key. Override with your own app's API key if necessary.

Method Detail

login

public static Session login(java.lang.String eMail,
                            java.lang.String password)
                     throws SmugmugException
Logs into a Smugmug Account using the account's e-mail and password. It establishes a working session for this account. This session is returned.

Parameters:
eMail - Account's e-mail.
password - Account's password.
Returns:
Working session.
Throws:
SmugmugException

loginWithHash

public static Session loginWithHash(int userID,
                                    java.lang.String hashedPassword)
                             throws SmugmugException
Logs into a Smugmug Account using the account's User-ID and hashed-password. It establishes a working session for this account. This session is returned.

Parameters:
userID - Account's User-id
hashedPassword - Hashed password for this account.
Returns:
Working session.
Throws:
SmugmugException

loginAnonymously

public static Session loginAnonymously()
                                throws SmugmugException
Logs into Smugmug anonymously and returns a guest's working session.

Returns:
Working session for a guest.
Throws:
SmugmugException

isAnonymous

public boolean isAnonymous()
Determines if current session is anonymous, i.e. whether it was logged in as a guest or not.

Returns:
True only if the session is anonymous. False if logged in with an account and password.

getAPIKey

public java.lang.String getAPIKey()
Returns this app's API Key.

Returns:
API key

isInvalid

public boolean isInvalid()
Determines if the current session in valid. Invalid session is established by logging out.

Returns:
True if the current session is invalid (e.g. logged out)

getSessionID

public java.lang.String getSessionID()
Returns the session's ID (as used by Smugmug).

Returns:
The session-id.

getAccountType

public Session.ACCOUNT_TYPE getAccountType()
Returns the user's account type.

Returns:
Account type.

getFilesizeLimit

public int getFilesizeLimit()
Max limit for the size of files that can be uploaded using this session.

Returns:
Max upload size.

me

public Account me()
The logged in user account. This will never be 'null'.

Returns:
The logged in user account.

forOtherAccount

public Session forOtherAccount(java.lang.String nickName,
                               java.lang.String sitePassword)
Call this method if you're interested in data of another user's account. E.g. you'd like to examine some galleries (Albums) of another user. This method returns a session that is tied to an account representing the other user.

Parameters:
nickName - The other user's nick-name (as known on Smugmug).
sitePassword - If necessary, the other user's site-password.
Returns:
A new working session to obtain data for another user-account.

getOtherAccount

public Account getOtherAccount()
The account for which data needs to be returned. E.g. You can be logged in (me() returns the logged in account), but you could be interested in another user's galleries. The other user is represented by this method. The method 'forOtherAccount' establishes such a session.

Returns:
The account

getNickName

public java.lang.String getNickName()
Returns:
The nick-name that is represented by this session's account.

reLogin

public Session reLogin()
                throws SmugmugException
You can relogin and create a new session. Data from this session is used (user-id hashed password) to establish this new session. This method also works if this session is invalid. This method can be used to establish a new valid session using the current login-credentials.

Returns:
New working session.
Throws:
SmugmugException

logout

public void logout()
            throws SmugmugException
Call this method to log out. The session will become invalid.

Throws:
SmugmugException

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
